intro: Dryopteris hirta f. genuina, commonly known as the Hairy Wood Fern, is a fern species characterized by its distinctive fronds with a hairy texture. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is native to regions of East Asia, including Japan and China. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its fronds are usually bi- or tri-pinnate, with a compact, upright growth habit. The spores are produced on the undersides of the fronds in sori, which are clustered in lines along the veins.
